bibl.title: "Texts, Transmissions, Receptions. Modern Approaches to Narratives"

bibl.seg: Mark de Kreij, Transmission and Textual Variants: Divergent Fragments of Sappho's Songs Examined.

André Lardinois, Sophie Levie, Hans Hoeken & Christoph Lüthy (edd.), Texts, Transmissions, Receptions. Modern Approaches to Narratives = Radboud Studies in Humanities. 1 (Leiden - Boston, 2015) pp. 17-34.

There is no reason to assume that each fragment of Sappho's songs we find in other authors or even on papyri should have had the form that is found in the standard edition. Different kinds of transmission were fuelled by different kinds of motivation and created in divergent environments.
